item.title: Stalker 2's 35-minute developer deep dive shows off its gorgeously bleak post-apocalyptic world
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/stalker-2s-35-minute-deep-dive-shows-off-its-gorgeously-bleak-post-apocalyptic-world

Ahead of November's launch.

Following Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl's recent delay to November, developer GSC Game World has rewarded patient fans with a new 35-minute deep dive into the post-apocalyptic horror shooter sequel - showcasing a mission across its bleak, beautiful open-world.

Stalker 2's "huge" world - officially known as the Chornobyl Exclusion Zone - consists of 20 regions, each with its own residents, anomalies, and nature. It's also said to feature few barriers, meaning players are free explore locations as they choose - with the goal being to "give the feeling of freedom, to give the feeling of loneliness, to give the feeling of anxiety".

While GSC's deep dive offers a good look at Stalker 2's strikingly varied enviromental work, the bulk of it is focused on the swamp - a formerly inhabited region, free of Stalkers but home to many other dangers, that plays host to a quest in which players must disable deadly, repurposed psi-beacons in order to reach the Clear Sky base.

As the quest played out, GSC emphasises the freeform nature of its mission design, explaining that it's impossible to see all content and every character in a single playthrough - players will get a slightly different story, slightly different quests, and meet different people depending on the choices they make.

Some of those choices might be tied to missions - at one point we see the player opting to approach a key location from the comparative safety of a rat-infested wine cellar rather than the potentially deadlier overground - while others are more organic. GSC says it's encouraging exploration by placing new equipment, weapons, weapon attachments, and upgrades out in the world - many of which can't be acquired through the story.

In total, Stalker 2 will feature 35 weapons, and each can be equipped with different upgrades and attachments for greater diversity. They'll be used against the likes of zombies, Pseudodogs (which roam in packs alongside phantom versions of themselves), and mutant pigs known as the Flesh. GSC notes its AI doesn't cheat by knowing where the player is at all times, and will instead hunt them by first hypothesing where they'll be.

Players will want to keep an eye on their hunger levels and tiredness to ensure their efficiency doesn't dwindle, and they'll also need to be mindful of their equipment load, as overburdening will limit their movement. GSC says it's deliberately avoided making Stalker 2 easy for players, as this would "kill the grip of reality" - an attitude reflected in the decision to forego a levelling system in favour of more naturalistic pogression, with players improving as they grow more familiar with the environment, or gain faster reactions through experience.

GSC's full 35-minute deep dive features plenty more tidbits of information - including a little about the routines of different people in the Zone, and the dynamic nature of factions, which can sometimes change their leader, even break up - and it's well worth a watch, if only to goggle at its gorgeously bleak environments.

Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl is now set to launch on 20th Novmber, when it'll be available on Xbox Series X/S, PC (via Steam, GOG, Epic, and GSC's website), and Game Pass.

item.title: Valve's Yet-To-Be-Announced Multiplayer Game Already Has Thousands Of Players On Steam
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/valve-next-game-deadlock-early-access-beta-steamdb-pc-1851620354

Officially, Valve‚Äîthe company behind Steam, Half-Life, and more‚Äîhas yet to announce its next big game. However, thousands of people are currently playing and posting about Deadlock, Valve‚Äôs next big game, literally right now. So uh, what‚Äôs going on?

Suggested Reading

The Top 10 Most-Played Games On Steam Deck: June 2023 Edition

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Thanks to leakers and dataminers, we‚Äôve known about a Valve-developed multiplayer game for a few years now. Before it was Deadlock, it was likely codenamed Neon Prime. At one point since it reportedly started development in 2018, the MOBA/character shooter hybrid was possibly going to be set in the Half-Life/Portal universe, but that has seemingly changed based on gameplay leaks that occurred in May. Now, it seems a rumored playtest for Deadlock is currently underway, with the game developing a community of players on Reddit.

As spotted by IGN, over on SteamDB‚Äîa third-party website that tracks various stats about Steam games and players‚ÄîDeadlock‚Äôs player count has been steadily increasing over the last few months. In the last few days, the game cracked 18,000 concurrent players. That means it‚Äôs one of the top 65 most played games on Steam, and Valve has yet to even tweet about it or release a trailer.

IGN reports that Deadlock‚Äôs current early access period is using an invite system, letting players on Steam grant access to other players. It‚Äôs understood that Valve is allowing players with early access to talk about the game online with other players, but videos and screenshots still seem to be under a strict NDA. Many are posting about the game and how much they like it on the Deadlockthegame subreddit.

That means we are in a really weird and somewhat unprecedented situation. A new Valve video game is gaining thousands of players on Steam, it‚Äôs got an active subreddit, and we‚Äôve even seen videos of the game in action. Deadlock is real. It‚Äôs a thing. It‚Äôs Valve‚Äôs next game. Yet, officially, Valve has yet to announce it or even tease it.

Many players assume that a full-on reveal for Deadlock and an open-access beta are coming sooner rather than later, with many suggesting September. But for now, we have to wait and see when Valve will decide to announce a game that thousands of people are playing and which already has guides and tier rankings. Strange times. Meanwhile, Valve might be working on Half-Life 3 based on some recent leaks. Strange times indeed, folks.

.

item.title: Deadlock, Valve's New Hero Shooter, Is Quietly Amassing Thousands of Playtesters
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/deadlock-valves-new-hero-shooter-is-quietly-amassing-thousands-of-playtesters

Is an actual announcement imminent?

We've known since earlier this year that Valve was quietly working on a new game, a sort of cross between hero shooters and MOBAs called Deadlock. But we never got an official announcement. Now, it looks like thousands of people are already playing the game in some sort of early play test, with the game reaching over 18,000 concurrent players earlier today.

Per SteamDB, Deadlock playercount started slowly climbing earlier this month, reaching a peak of 18,254 earlier today and expected to climb further. IGN understands that the game's current early access period is operating under an invite system, where certain Steam users are receiving invites and can then suggest other individuals to also receive invites.

Since testers started sharing Deadlock screenshots all over the place, here's ones I can verify, featuring one of the heroes called Grey Talon. pic.twitter.com/KdZSRxObSz

‚Äî ‚ÄéGabe Follower (@gabefollower) May 17, 2024

Sreenshots and video footage of the game available to the general public remain minimal, given that players are required to sign a strict NDA before being permitted to play. However, players are free to discuss their experiences with the game, with a "DeadlockTheGame" subreddit already accruing members and discussion of early impressions.

What we know so far is that Deadlock seems to be a mishmash of hero shooter ala Overwatch and MOBA with lane-based gameplay like DOTA 2 and tower defense elements. It takes place in a fantasy/steampunk setting. While we haven't gotten good looks at its hero cast just yet for the reasons outlined above, everyone currently playing seems to really love one character in particular:

Me: I don't' get attached to things that easily!
Also me after 0.2 seconds of playing Deadlock: pic.twitter.com/1EUfO0AK4d

‚Äî Moirai Agar'el ‚ôªÔ∏èüíö Slime Mom - SÃ∂cÃ¥uÃ¥fÃ∏fÃ∏ Ã∏AÃµRÃ∂cÃ¥ (@MoiraiVT) August 9, 2024

With the growing playerbase and invites seemingly available to anyone willing to ask, it seems likely that an actual for-real official announcement of Deadlock may be imminent. Valve's been on a bit of a spree with stealth releases lately, having quietly dropped Counter-Strike 2 last year and Half-Life: Alyx being announced just a few short months before its eventual release.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

In This Article

item.title: New Vegas Director Down To Make Another Fallout Game, But Has Some Questions
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/fallout-new-vegas-2-director-sawyer-xbox-bethesda-1851620259

Many Fallout fans consider Fallout: New Vegas the best game in the series. So folks have long wanted a sequel or similar spin-off led by New Vegas game director Josh Sawyer. And according to him, he‚Äôs down to do it, assuming he‚Äôs not too constrained by Bethesda.

Suggested Reading

Why Fallout: New Vegas Is Still Canon After The TV Show

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Developed by Obsidian and released in 2010, Fallout: New Vegas took Bethesda‚Äôs Fallout 3 tech and built a new game out of it. The end result is a beloved open-world RPG that people still talk about and play a lot in 2024. (For example, people freaked out earlier this year when the recent Fallout TV show seemed to hint at New Vegas not being canon anymore.) And ever since New Vegas devs Obsidian and Fallout owners Bethesda have both been under Microsoft‚Äôs roof, people have wondered if a New Vegas 2 might ever happen. While the game‚Äôs director didn‚Äôt confirm or deny anything, he did at least say that yes, he‚Äôd be up for making another Fallout.

In a video Q&A posted on August 11 and spotted by Gamesradar, Sawyer answered a series of fan questions related to his past projects, thoughts on game design, and general questions about RPGs. Toward the end of the video, someone asked him what his response would be if Microsoft or Bethesda asked him to lead another Fallout game.

‚ÄúUhhhhhh, sure,‚Äù said Sawyer, followed by some laughter. However, he did explain that he would have some questions before hopping on board a new Fallout sequel.

‚ÄúI mean with any project I think it has to do with: what are we doing? What are the boundaries that we‚Äôre working within? What am I allowed to do and not allowed to do?‚Äù explained Sawyer.

For Sawyer, the big thing seems to be freedom. He said he would only step up to make a new Fallout (or any game based on a pre-existing IP) if he wasn‚Äôt too constrained by the IP holder.

‚ÄúI think that with any IP, especially one I‚Äôve worked with before, the question is what do I want to do this time that I wasn‚Äôt able to do last time. And if those constraints are just really constraining, then it‚Äôs not very appealing because who wants to work on something where the one thing they want to explore is not possible to explore?‚Äù said Sawyer.

He then reiterated that he still loves the Fallout franchise, adding: ‚ÄúI think there‚Äôs still a ton of stories that can be told in there and questions that can be asked about society.‚Äù

Sawyer ended his answer by pointing out that working with any IP is like that and ultimately it comes down to ‚Äúwhat are we allowed to do and not allowed to do‚Äù with the characters and world.

So is it possible that Sawyer could lead the charge on a new Fallout game, maybe even a New Vegas follow-up? Yes. But Bethesda will have to let the famed designer do what he and the team want or they won‚Äôt be interested in playing in that radioactive wasteland.

 .

item.title: Best Nintendo Switch Game Deals This Week - Zelda And Mario Games For Big Discounts
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/best-nintendo-switch-deals-games-controllers-nintendo-consoles/1100-6525715/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo Switch exclusives don‚Äôt go on sale as often as games for other platforms, and it‚Äôs not uncommon to see games that were released years ago still listed at full price. However, a few big Nintendo titles are currently discounted--including big price cuts on multiple Zelda games, including Tears of the Kingdom, and smaller discounts on recent releases such as Luigi's Mansion 2 HD and Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door. Aside from games, the Switch Pro Controller is discounted to just $58 (was $70), and the Nintendo Switch Lite: Animal Crossing Bundle is $159 (was $200), making this a good time to pick up new gear for your game room.

Head over to Walmart, and you'll find Luigi's Mansion 2 HD available for $51 (was $60). It may not seem like much, but that's actually one of the lowest prices we've seen all year. Offering updated graphics, enhanced controls, and various quality-of-life improvements, this is the ideal way to experience the adventure. Be sure to check it out if you missed the original on Nintendo 3DS.

Other great deals include Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door for $52 (was $60), Splatoon 3 for $40 (was $60), and Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze for $40 (was $48). Splatoon 3 is the best option if you're seeking online multiplayer, as its competitive scene is still incredibly active and gives you plenty of unlockables to work toward. You also can't go wrong with Mario Kart 8 Deluxe--which is also on sale at Walmart for $40 (was $60).

If you haven't played Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, you can add it to your collection for just $50 (was $70). Arguably the best Nintendo Switch game, Tears of the Kingdom is a remarkable adventure with brilliant puzzles, a truly unique physics system, and a mesmerizing open world that extends above and below the already sprawling version of Hyrule from its predecessor. Speaking of the game that laid the foundation for open-world Zelda, you can grab Breath of the Wild for $40 (was $60).

Plenty of other Switch exclusives are on sale right now, and you'll find the best deals below. With just over a month to go before the release of The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, now's a good time to catch up on some games you may have missed. You should check out our Echoes of Wisdom preorder guide for details on exclusive bonuses, the limited-edition Nintendo Switch Lite, and the reprint of the absolutely adorable Link's Awakening and Wind Waker Zelda Amiibo figures that are arriving the same day.

Best Nintendo Switch Game Deals in August 2024

  • Luigi's Mansion 2 HD -- $51 ($60)
  • Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door -- $52 ($60)
  • Splatoon 3 -- $40 ($60)
  • Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze -- $40 ($60)
  • Mario Kart 8 Deluxe -- $40 ($60)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild -- $40 ($60)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom -- $50 ($70)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword HD -- $40 ($60)
  • Kirby's Return to Dreamland: Deluxe Edition -- $40 ($60)
  • Miitopia -- $42 ($50)
  • Super Mario RPG -- $40 ($60)
  • Super Mario Maker 2 -- $40 ($60)
  • Super Monkey Ball Banana Rumble -- $35 ($50)
  • Super Mario Bros. Wonder -- $46 ($60)
  • Princess Peach: Showtime -- $50 ($60)
  • Princess Peach: Showtime + Exclusive Hair Scrunchie -- $60
  • Pokemon Shining Pearl -- $44 ($60)
  • Pokemon Scarlet & Violet Dual Pack -- $100 ($120)
  • Super Mario Party + Red & Blue Joy-Con Bundle -- $90 ($100)

Best Nintendo Controller Deals in August 2024

item.title: Two Of The Best Zelda And Link Amiibo Figures Will Return Alongside Echoes Of Wisdom
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/links-awakening-link-wind-waker-zelda-amiibo/1100-6525740/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Link's Awakening Link and Wind Waker Zelda Amiibo figures are coming back to commemorate the upcoming launch of The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom. The reprints are identical to the original versions--Link's Amiibo features the adorable doll-like art style from the Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening remake that launched on Nintendo Switch back in 2019, while the Zelda figure captures her appearance from The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker. The reprints officially launch on September 26, and you can preorder both for $16 each at Best Buy. We recommend grabbing them quickly if interested, since we don't know how many figures Nintendo made for this reprinting and most Amiibo figures sell out before launch.

This Link's Awakening Link and Wind Waker Zelda Amiibo reprints drop alongside the next game in the series, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom. The Switch-exclusive adventure features the same top-down presentation and toy-like art style of the Link's Awakening remake but mixes things up in big ways, most notably making Princess Zelda the main playable character for the first time. Rather than being a simple copy of Link's moveset and abilities, Echoes of Wisdom gives Zelda her own unique powers--specifically a magical wand that copies objects scattered around the world to aid in exploration, combat, and puzzle-solving.

Be sure to check out our latest coverage of the game to read about all the ways the new game is shaking up the 2D Zelda formula, and hit up our preorder guide to see everywhere you can buy The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom ahead of its September 26 release date. If you're fast, you can preorder the game at Best Buy and get an acrylic diorama set featuring Zelda, and Octorok, and a cardboard standee. The limited gold Hyrule Edition Switch Lite that launches alongside Echoes of Wisdom is also available for preorder.

  • Best Nintendo Switch Game Deals This Week - Zelda And Mario Games For Big Discounts

  • Snag 11 Jeff VanderMeer Books For $18 - Catch Up On Southern Reach Before Absolution Releases

item.title: McDonald's Finally Brings Back Collector's Cups And They Won't Poison You This Time
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/mcdonalds-happy-meal-collectors-cups-shrek-barbie-1851620251

McDonald‚Äôs is paying tribute to its lucrative merchandising past with a new set of collector‚Äôs meal cups that star past McDonald‚Äôs cup icons like Grimace, Hello Kitty, and Shrek. They‚Äôre plastic instead of glass, but they won‚Äôt leach heavy metals into your bloodstream this time either.

Suggested Reading

April's Air Combos Make Her TMNT: Shredder‚Äôs Revenge‚Äôs Raddest Playable Character

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

The fast-food chain announced the newest Happy Meal prizes last week and will begin giving them out on August 13. There are six collector‚Äôs cups in total, each featuring art based on characters and themes from Happy Meals past:

  • Coca-Cola
  • Beanie Babies
  • Hello Kitty and Peanuts
  • Barbie and Hot Wheels
  • Shrek, Jurassic Park and Minions
  • The Grimace Glass, Boo Buckets, and Funny Fry Friends

Collector‚Äôs cups have a long history when it comes to McDonald‚Äôs Happy Meal giveaways, but none is more notorious than the 2010 Shrek recall. The company had to recall 12 million glass cups promoting Shrek Forever After after the painted images on them featuring the ogre and his friends were found to contain trace amounts of cadmium. The new Shrek cup won‚Äôt have that problem, although the jury is still out on how many microplastics come in each drink of soda from them.

Fortunately, the cups are really more for displaying, and I‚Äôm as much of a sucker for colorful, commercial nostalgia as anyone else. Less fortunately, McDonald‚Äôs Happy Meals are more expensive than ever. A recent study claimed prices on some items, from McGriddles to Big Macs, had gone up over 40 percent since the pandemic. To fight back against the perception that its ‚Äúvalue‚Äù menu was becoming overpriced, the company launched a $5 meal over the summer.

We‚Äôll see if the collector‚Äôs cup campaign can recall the frenzy that occurred back in 2021 when Happy Meals briefly came with special edition Pok√©mon cards. Now there‚Äôs a collector‚Äôs cup I would gorge myself on McNuggets to get.

item.title: Nacon Delays Terminator: Survivors Launch to 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nacon-delays-terminator-survivors-launch-to-2025/

In a new post on X today, Nacon announced that it will now delay the Terminator: Survivors launch until 2025, previously expected to release in October 2024. Nacon broadly cited the need for ‚Äúsome additional time‚Äù in order to realize its vision for the game. The studio also wants to ‚Äúdeliver the game that fits your expectations.‚Äù Nacon did not break down the exact cause for delay, nor offer a more concrete release window. However, the devs say they are impressed by fan enthusiasm, and thanked the community for their understanding and support. Although fans are dismayed by Terminator: Survivors‚Äô delay, they did support the decision to await a smooth launch.

  Nacon first revealed Terminator: Survivors in February 2024, during the Nacon Connect showcase. A couple of months later, Nacon confirmed more details about the game during a Q&A session. Terminator: Survivors is an open-world survival game and first-person shooter, built in Unreal Engine 5. It will support co-op, as well as offline single-player gameplay. According to the official Steam page, players will ‚Äúmeet iconic characters of the franchise as well as original ones.‚Äù It will also feature ‚Äúan unexplored storyline‚Äù about Judgment Day. Terminator: Survivors previously planned to launch on PC on October 24, 2024, with console versions releasing later on. Most recently, Nacon shared a development video late last June, explaining the game‚Äôs inspiration from James Cameron‚Äôs original two films.

For more of the latest gaming news, you can read about Motorsport Games revealing an optimistic financial report and console plans for Le Mans Ultimate, and sign up for the Insider Gaming newsletter.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Achievements in Black Myth: Wukong
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-achievements-in-black-myth-wukong/

I don‚Äôt consider myself an achievement hunter. I see the appeal, and I‚Äôm excited to watch one of those videos on YouTube of someone achieving one of the rarest trophies in a game, but I don‚Äôt want to put in the work myself. I‚Äôm happy just playing the game. That said, if you fall into the former camp, here‚Äôs a look at all achievements in Black Myth: Wukong!

All of the Black Myth: Wukong Achievements

You‚Äôre in for quite the journey! In total, the Black Myth: Wukong achievements number more than 80! It‚Äôll likely take multiple playthroughs, perhaps a few in New Game+, to unlock every single achievement and trophy in the game on your favorite system. But to help you prepare, here‚Äôs a complete overview of all 81 achievements in the game:

  1. A Curious Collection ‚Äì Every rare wonder the world can offer, collected and kept.
  2. A Duel of Destiny ‚Äì Two minds‚Äô long fray leaves but one to stay.
  3. A Family Finished ‚Äì Together at last, the scorpions united.
  4. A Great Gust ‚Äì There will be more sages if their maker still engages.
  5. A Willing Warrior ‚Äì ‚ÄúI‚Äôll live to serve him who brought my liege here.‚Äù
  6. Absorb and Cultivate ‚Äì Consume those who had consumed.
  7. Always Accompanied ‚Äì How odd to encounter this old man at every corner!
  8. Behold the Betrayal ‚Äì More eyes do not see more than mortal trifles.
  9. Blazing Black Wind ‚Äì Of all things to learn, you chose to play with fire?
  10. Boundless Bitterness ‚Äì Evening light on snow, rigidity ends in woe.
  11. Brew of Bravery ‚Äì Fresh brew in an old cask. May it stir a great task!
  12. Brewer‚Äôs Bounty ‚Äì A blend for every brew to bring out its best.
  13. Brews and Barrels ‚Äì Now you can sate yourself with all the drinks.
  14. Buried in the Sand ‚Äì The tiger, the child, both loat in the wild.
  15. Cage of Claws ‚Äì Smoke rises high, his doom shall arrive.
  16. Corrupted Captains ‚Äì How mighty would those four spirits be if I could harness their power
  17. Creative Concoction ‚Äì Tonics are well and good, but not be wolfed like food!
  18. Cursed Clan ‚Äì A whole nest of rats scatters and falls.
  19. Death in Despair ‚Äì Resonant waves profound, he is now buried in the ground.
  20. Devoted Disciples ‚Äì Such a waste for those four grand titles.
  21. Enduring Echoes ‚Äì Three bells sound, lost souls bound.
  22. Final Fulfillment ‚Äì Each ordeal paves your path to what you are meant to be.
  23. Flaming Fury ‚Äì The golden child brought fire and smoke: when they cleared, the family broke.
  24. Frost and Flame ‚Äì The merging ice and fire, swift and severe.
  25. Full of Forms ‚Äì Each guise grants a new horizon.
  26. Gleams of Gold ‚Äì The drunk said there‚Äôs gold here. Do you believe him?
  27. Gnashing Grudge ‚Äì Harsh, rash, ever unquelled. Rank, dank, muck-impelled.
  28. Gourds Gathered ‚Äì Rare is not the gourd but the friend to drink with.
  29. Guardian of Gear ‚Äì You are fully fitted. Now, swing that staff and fight!
  30. Hammer and Hew ‚Äì Armed head to toe, dread not the foe.
  31. Handy and Hardy ‚Äì A good match calls for a good weapon.
  32. Happy Harvest ‚Äì Fields kept him leave him to skim.
  33. Home is Behind ‚Äì The old monkey has told his tale. Onward you must go.
  34. Karma of Kang-Jin ‚Äì Now one less dwells in the dome stars.
  35. Lust and Dust ‚Äì Each and every one holds their own truth.
  36. Mantled with Might ‚Äì Shoes on feet, hat on head, embroidered shirt, Daoist robe-free as can be, doing as you please!
  37. Marvelous Melon ‚Äì A quirky man, a vanished melon patch, a marvelous spell, and an unexpected meeting.
  38. Master of Magic ‚Äì All spells we know are derived from the same source.
  39. Matches with the Macaque ‚Äì You don‚Äôt need to wait for the perfect moment to soar to greater heights.
  40. Medicine Meal ‚Äì ‚ÄúHere, have it, have it all.‚Äù
  41. Meet the Match ‚Äì ‚ÄúLet go of him, and you let go of all.‚Äù
  42. Mei of Memory ‚Äì Bonds from bygone days still pull at the heart.
  43. Misfit with Merit ‚Äì Never will she see with him the world beyond.
  44. Mud on his face ‚Äì An odd yaoguai killed, an odd mirror earned.
  45. Nifty Nonsense ‚Äì The fat monkey failed, for he spoke too much.
  46. Om Many Padme H√ªm ‚Äì Search each Buddha‚Äôs head, in his perilous land, stones reside.
  47. Page Preserver ‚Äì ‚ÄúAll the tattered pages can now be compiled in full‚Äù.
  48. Portraits Perfected ‚Äì Humans, beasts, yaoguais, and the Bodisattvas, All recorded and noted.
  49. Pound and Perfect ‚Äì ‚ÄúThrough fire, armor is refined; through trials, strength is defined.‚Äù
  50. Precious Pills ‚Äì In furnace there is fire, and in fire there are pills.
  51. Scenic Seeker ‚Äì The most marvelous places for meditation have all met your gaze.
  52. Secret in Purple Cloud ‚Äì ‚ÄúWhat use are eight arms against twenty strikes with my staff?‚Äù
  53. Secret in the Scroll ‚Äì Near the hut the crops thrive: in the Painted Palm, their hearts lie.
  54. Seeds to Sow ‚Äì Take more as fruit as your plants take root.
  55. Shell and Scales ‚Äì To die is as woeful as to live alone.
  56. Shifting Sands ‚Äì The beetle came with dumbreats‚Äô call, and left with waves‚Äô gentle fall.
  57. Six Senses Secured ‚Äì After all that strife and struggle, what‚Äôs truly been gained?
  58. Slithering Snake ‚Äì The white-clad one pled his case. Spare him some days of grace.
  59. Souls in the Stalks ‚Äì You‚Äôve picked them all, the easy ones and the hard ones.
  60. Sound in Stone ‚Äì No words of kind. Pay them no mind.
  61. Staffs and Spears ‚Äì A walking vault of arms you have become!
  62. Temple of Taint ‚Äì Now at the end is the elder‚Äôs long wait for the journeyed.
  63. The Clamor of Frogs ‚Äì Six frogs, six skills-how intriguing!
  64. The Cloud Claimed ‚Äì Wings alone pale beside his greater gift!
  65. The Cockerel Crowed ‚Äì Long and short, far and near, and span has its year.
  66. The Five Skandhas ‚Äì The powerful pill still carries her caring wish.
  67. The Furnace Boy ‚Äì Ha! A devoted Daoist should not be so polished!
  68. The Loong Pattern ‚Äì In the air, they swing, yet it‚Äôs already ending.
  69. The Passion Passes ‚Äì Not even one of them looked back.
  70. The Soaring Slash ‚Äì A mere test of skill turned into a fight for the kill.
  71. The Stone‚Äôs Secret ‚Äì The odd boulder has something curious inside.
  72. The Tiger Family ‚Äì The brothers and their father. You‚Äôve met them all.
  73. The Wayward Ways ‚Äì ‚ÄúIs that ugliness a promise of immortality? Better leave it.‚Äù
  74. Thousand-Mile Quest ‚Äì Oh woe, oh woe, long trails they did go.
  75. Three Treams of Two ‚Äì The six valiant captains who only fight in number.
  76. Threaded Tracls ‚Äì ‚ÄúCall of the chase! You‚Äôve crushed every yaogua here‚Ä¶‚Äù
  77. Treasure Trove ‚Äì ‚ÄúAll the four vessels now belong to me!‚Äù
  78. Urge Unfulfilled ‚Äì ‚ÄúWith my life, I‚Äôll repay this title he gave me!‚Äù
  79. Voice Vanquished ‚Äì Red eyes mark wrong charts. The scripture needs amends.
  80. Warring with Wolves ‚Äì False is his name. Slay him all the same!
  81. With Full Spirit ‚Äì Their mighty Spirits are now gathered within you.

When Can You Play Black Myth: Wukong?

Seriously, I‚Äôm right there with you. I want to get my hands on Black Myth: Wukong! But if you‚Äôre looking to track down and unlock all achievements in Black Myth: Wukong, you must wait until August 20 to play the game. Black Myth: Wukong launches simultaneously on PC and PlayStation 5, but sadly, there‚Äôs still no word about the Xbox Series X|S release date. It‚Äôs coming; the studio just doesn‚Äôt know when.

To help you unlock achievements, it‚Äôs nice knowing the game is mostly linear so that you won‚Äôt have to run far and wide. What do you think? Would Black Myth: Wukong be better as an open-world game or a linear one?

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

Who Made Star Wars Outlaws? ‚Äì Answered

There‚Äôs a serious amount of marketing surrounding Star Wars Outlaws, alongside name recognition. It‚Äôs the first-ever open-world single-player Star Wars game, as we cannot forget the beloved Star Wars Galaxies, and it‚Äôs making waves for many reasons. Some of them are good, some of them bad. First and foremost, who made Star Wars Outlaws? Who [‚Ä¶]

Is Star Wars Outlaws Coming to Game Pass? ‚Äì Answered

Depending on how often you play new video games, paying for a monthly subscription service to test out new releases is generally cheaper before pulling the trigger. It‚Äôs a fantastic way to remain informed and try the games you‚Äôre on the fence about. With that in mind, is Star Wars Outlaws coming to Game Pass? [‚Ä¶]

Is Delta Force: Hawk Ops Coming to PS5? ‚Äì Answered

I‚Äôve recently had the pleasure of sitting down and playing Delta Force: Hawk Ops as part of its PC Alpha test, and I‚Äôm pleasantly surprised. I don‚Äôt typically lean into first-person shooters with hero-type characters, but this one captured me from the first bullet whizzing by my head. It‚Äôs downright fun, with so much potential. [‚Ä¶]

Where to Find Brahmin in Fallout 76

Appalachia is home to an abundant number of Brahmin. You‚Äôll find them roaming the wilds, penned up at the Blue Ridge Caravan Company, chewing grass in the fields of a farmstead, and lying motionless on the side of the road. But when it counts most, here is where to find Brahmin in Fallout 76! Top [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Disney Lorcana D23 Event Reveals Oswald, Pixar, and Rescue Rangers Cards
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/disney-lorcana-d23-event-reveals-oswald-pixar-and-rescue-rangers-cards

This past weekend, Disney held its D23 fan event. It is a major event where The Walt Disney Company reveals its upcoming slate of projects and attractions; everything from new theme park rides to the latest wave of Marvel movies. During the Disney Lorcana D23 event, they announced their plans for the next two years of their card game.

The Disney Lorcana D23 Event Announcements

Every announcement at the Disney Lorcana D23 live event has been collected into a single post on the D23 website.Senior Brand Manager and Disney Lorcana Co-Designer Ryan Miller opened the event remarking on the game's launch, referring to it as "a roller-coaster on a rodeo."

Miller continued the event citing several notable metrics for Disney Lorcana. To date, more than 1 billion cards have been sold, that is 131,000 cards sold every hour. The Disney Lorcana companion app has been downloaded over 400,000 times, and more than 76,000 organized play events have been held worldwide.

The Disney Lorcana D23 event also delves into the game's creative process. This included behind-the-scenes material showcasing the creation of a single Disney Lorcana card.

Last but not least, several new events and cards were announced for Disney Lorcana. Four major regional events are scheduled for the remainder of 2024 in Las Vegas, Nevada, Toronto, Canada, Birmingham, England, and Seattle Washington. Several new Disney Lorcana championships have also been announced:

  • In December, a European Disney Lorcana Championship will be held at the Disneyland Paris Resort.
  • In January, a North American Championship will be held at Disneyland Resort
  • In 2025, a World Championship will be held at Disney World, with the grand prize being a one-of-a-kind golden card featuring Mickey Mouse as the Brave Little Tailor.

Later this year, players can enjoy cards based on Oswald The Lucky Rabbit and Chip 'N Dale Rescue Rangers. As for dark fantasy fans, cards based on The Black Cauldron will arrive in 2025.

Lastly, 2026 will see the release of an official Pocahontas card, and a set of cards based on the stories, characters, and songs by Pixar.

The Disney Lorcana D23 event coincides with the launch of Shimmering Skies, the fifth set for Disney Lorcana.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. This‚Ä¶ More about Tyler

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Took Longer To Make Than Any Previous Game In The Series
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/assassins-creed-shadows-japan-yasuke-ubisoft-4-years-1851620163

Assassin‚Äôs Creed Shadows is the next main entry in Ubisoft‚Äôs long-running open-world historical stab-a-thon series. The big game arrives later this year, and when it does, it will have had the longest development cycle in the franchise‚Äôs nearly 20-year history.

Suggested Reading

The Week In Games: Pok√©mon With Guns And More New Releases

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Announced in 2022 as ‚ÄúAssassin‚Äôs Creed Red‚Äù, Shadows is the first main entry in the franchise to be set in Japan‚Äîsomething fans have wanted for some time now‚Äîand stars two protagonists. (You‚Äôve probably heard about that as a small but angry portion of the internet has yelled online about it recently.) Ubisoft Quebec, the same studio behind 2018's Assassin‚Äôs Creed Odyssey and 2015's Syndicate, started working on Shadows in 2020. That means when it arrives in November it will have been in development for four years, which is longer than normal.

In an interview with GamesIndustry.biz, Shadows lead producer Karl Onn√©e explained that developing games for extended periods of time like this is all about balance between ‚Äútime and costs.‚Äù And that the real path to success is via iteration, something that takes time.

‚ÄúThe more time you have, the more you can iterate,‚Äù said Onn√©e. ‚ÄúYes, you can put more people on a project and do it in a shorter time, but that doesn‚Äôt give you more time to iterate, because it takes time to get the feedback from your players, your team‚Ä¶ and then see what works and what doesn‚Äôt and how to improve it.‚Äù

According to the producer, four years offers ‚Äúthe right balance to go from conception to production and get the feedback necessary to adapt.‚Äù

How Assassin‚Äôs Creed Mirage Helped Shadows

Onn√©e explained that one example of iteration on Shadows involved last year‚Äôs smaller, well-received Assassin‚Äôs Creed Mirage. That game took the series back to being a more stealth-focused adventure, something the devs working on Shadows took note of and built upon.

‚ÄúDuring production we do playtests with people from different places at different stages,‚Äù he explains. ‚ÄúWe look at what works and what doesn‚Äôt, and we also look at the playtests with Mirage and see what people like. We knew we were going in the direction of stealth with Shadows, and so we saw what they were doing and learned from that. We said ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs use what they‚Äôve done and build on top of it,‚Äô rather than going our own way.‚Äù

The Ubisoft producer added that all of the teams working on various Assassin‚Äôs Creed games are ‚Äúpart of the brand‚Äù and it‚Äôs important that all the studios are talking to each other to avoid ‚Äúredoing work.‚Äù

‚ÄúMaking games is difficult, it takes a lot of time and passion, and you want to avoid doing the same things but differently,‚Äù said Onn√©e.

‚ÄúYou want to build on top of work and improve on it. We have a lot of discussions with other teams to make sure if we‚Äôre doing similar things, we can collaborate and so if they want to do something afterward, we can take that into account. That‚Äôs what we do with our new Anvil pipeline, which is the tech teams working together. When we build new features, we make sure those features are available for all projects. We are continuing to build and improve all the time.‚Äù

Assassin‚Äôs Creed Shadows arrives on PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC on November 15.

.

item.title: First Escape from Tarkov Wipe Event Is Nothing New
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/tarkov-wipe-event-nothing-new/

The first Escape from Tarkov wipe event has kicked off and is in full force worldwide. It‚Äôs nothing new, though ‚Äì it‚Äôs something we‚Äôve seen before, and it‚Äôs expected that it‚Äôll be joined by other, typical pre-wipe events in due course. The event started after Battlestate Games had posted an image on socials showcasing in-game characters hefting around bags of concrete, and that was enough to give the game away.

For this first event, players will be able to level up their Hideout for nothing more than bottles of Pevko beer. Also, skill levels are climbing at an accelerated rate, which means that players will be able to hit max levels in a fraction of the time as wipe draws ever closer.

Wipe Soon?

The next Tarkov wipe is on the horizon, and it has been a long time coming. This is officially the longest gap we‚Äôve ever had between wipes at more than 225 days, and players are tired, to say the least. It has been a rocky few months for the Escape from Tarkov universe. First, there was the drama surrounding the release of Tarkov Arena, and then the reveal of The Unheard Edition threw the entire ecosystem into disarray. From the problems with incessant cheating to rampant instability, it has been a hard time to call yourslef a Tarkov fan of late.

But all that‚Äôs going to be pushed aside now that the first pre-wipe event has kicked off. It means that players are potentially days away from the all-important wipe that resets everyone‚Äôs account and brings hundreds of thousands of players back into the game. Plenty of changes and additions will be coming with the 0.15 patch that‚Äôll come in alongside the wipe, too.

For now, players can take part in this basic event here.

To level up your Hideout as quickly as possible, you‚Äôll need to collect Pevko beers. Fortunately, any enemy designated as a ‚ÄòBoss‚Äô is now guaranteed to drop them, so you can farm them quite easily. Also, as you adventure across Norvinsk slaying these tougher-than-normal characters, you‚Äôll find that your skill levels are climbing at an eye-watering pace, turning you into a super soldier in the blink of an eye.

As stressed, it‚Äôs the first pre-wipe event in Tarkov ‚Äì we can expect much more to come in the next few days.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that a new Stalker 2 deep dive trailer has been released

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
https://remapradio.com/articles/this-week-at-remap-34/

It feels weird to not have the Olympics buzzing on my TV, much like the cicadas buzzing outside. (The cicadas, meanwhile, have not left yet.) In fact, Rob and I were so distraught over the endless sports being over that we decided to record a podcast waxing nostalgic over and event that literally concluded over the weekend. Alas. We do plan to watch the paralympicsthis month, so if you have recommendations on athletes to keep track of, events that are particularly interesting, let us know! (P.S. We are aware we've been pretty sports-centric recently.)

-pk, who cannot f'ing wait for Alien: Romulus later this week

  • MONDAY: Rob and I have been watching a lot of Olympics the past two weeks, and supercharged by the way the men's and women's basketball teams finished, we decided to double dip on Sports!. (Yes, we talk a little Caleb Williams, too, but we are really really really really trying to play it cool.)
  • TUESDAY: We'll record an episode of HOA early with Janet, talking about Janet's office-to-studio transition, and how it's got someone like me considering a similar pivot this year. You'll hear that episode next week, but during the day, Remap's football geniuses will join forces to check out the new Madden, in which us playing it really really really cool about Caleb Williams will suddenly be thrust into the spotlight, as we try to win with the Bears.) I think we're also going to spin the wheel to determine the next My Turn episode. If Sports! editing gets gone early, Cado will release it on Tuesday, otherwise...
  • WEDNESDAY: ...Sports! will be released today. We're ditching the days between release. In the past, we dropped Sports! episodes on the main feed a few days later, timed to the Sunday NFL schedule, but it feels weird. The bonus you get for being a paid sub, like Remap Radio, is the podcast without ads. Cado and Rob will also take to the streams to continue motorsport managing.
  • THURSDAY: There will, hopefully, be a letter series that drop sometime this week, but as of this writing, I have not responded to Rob's prompt quite yet. Stay tuned, though. In the meantime, we'll be recording a new Remap Radio.
  • FRIDAY: Remap Radio goes live, amidst my push to finish Dragon's Dogma 2. We're at the endgame now, which opens the door to me finally playing Shadow of the Erdtree in the coming weeks. (I will also be preserving the play-for-30-minutes format for another game in the near future. Taking requests!)

If you have any support issues, send details on the issue to support@remapradio.com.

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.

item.title: Stalker 2 Team Releases 35-Minute ‚ÄòDeep Dive‚Äô Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/stalker-2-deep-dive-trailer/

GSC Game World has just given fans worldwide the best look at Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl ever. In an extended 35-minute walkthrough, the team guides players through various elements of this post-apocalyptic FPS title, which has been developing for over a decade. Outside of the recent leaks that showcased several minutes of rough gameplay, this is the longest and strongest look we‚Äôve had at Stalker 2 since it was announced more than ten years ago.

Recently, the team at GSC Game World revealed yet another delay for the highly anticipated open-world game. In an announcement that went hand-in-hand with a tongue-in-cheek trailer poking fun at all the postponements, it was revealed that the launch of Stalker 2 will be pushed back two months to November 20, 2024.

Everything You‚Äôd Want to Know

Stalker 2 has been coming for a long time, but there‚Äôs still a little longer to wait. If it runs well on launch, it‚Äôll be a very well-received game, as some trends have surfaced this year, such as the rampant popularity of the Fallout television series, that have left gamers worldwide hungry for a solid post-apocalyptic adventure. Given that it has been several years since the last major Stalker release, it‚Äôll also be a boon for fans of the franchise.

Several key details have been revealed in the massive gameplay walkthrough published today by GSC Game World:

Firstly, it‚Äôs stressed just how wide, open, and diverse ‚ÄòThe Zone‚Äô will be in Heart of Chornobyl. It‚Äôs a staggering world that features twenty regions, each of which offers unique elements that encourage open exploration. With that being said, the team has constructed the game from the ground up to give a sense of loneliness and apprehension as the player explores, fully unaware of what might be lingering around the corner.

Despite Stalker 2 being a solid competitor to games like Fallout, there‚Äôs no ‚Äòtraditional‚Äô levelling system in the game, which restricts the more RPG-focused elements some players might have been hoping for. It‚Äôs still Stalker at heart, though ‚Äì and that means that you‚Äôll still have those survival elements and some resource management to handle.

For instance, you need to manage your inventory to ensure you‚Äôre not carrying too much weight. Instead of a typical levelling system, Stalker 2 will unfold like Metro Exodus, with the player needing to explore and dig in all the game‚Äôs nooks and crannies to unlock attachments, weapons, equipment, and upgrades.

With a dynamic faction system, a whole host of nasties to battle, a massive open-world map, and countless opportunities to take on side quests and other assorted missions, Stalker 2 looks like the kind of game that you‚Äôll pour hours upon hours into.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Nacon has delayed Terminator Survivors

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Terminator: Survivors Delayed To 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/terminator-survivors-delayed-to-2025/1100-6525734/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nacon's upcoming Terminator game, Terminator: Survivors, will potentially bring the future war to life in a way that gamers have never seen before. But Judgment Day is going to have to wait. Nacon has announced that the game has been pushed back from its PC release date on October 24. Instead, both the PC and console versions of Terminator: Survivors will now be released in 2025.

Marco Ponte, Nacom's CEO and creative director, released a statement online that explains why the studio felt it needed more time to work on the game.

"This deferral of the game's release was a tough decision to make, however we believe that this additional time will enable us to ensure that our vision of the post-apocalyptic world of Terminator meets the expected level of quality," said Ponte. "On behalf of the Nacon Studio Milan team, I would like to thank all the players and fans of the franchise for their enthusiastic reception of Terminator: Survivors. We are extremely proud to have this opportunity to work on such an iconic franchise as Terminator, and are eager to reveal more of it to you. Thank you all for support‚Ä¶ We‚Äôll be back."

While the Terminator continuity has been mangled by the last two movies in the franchise, Terminator: Survivors is taking its cues from the first two films. The title is an open-world game set four years after Judgment Day, as humanity is still scrambling after Skynet's attempt to wipe them out. Gamers can play solo or join other players in co-op as they look for resources to build a base and mount an offensive against the machines.

Naturally, Skynet won't be taking that lying down, and numerous Terminators from the films will be featured in the game.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Call Of Duty Black Ops 6 Cutscenes Have Leaked Online
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-cutscenes-have-leaked-online/1100-6525736/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Activision's upcoming shooter Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 continues to be hit by leaks. This time, all of the campaign cutscenes have been leaked instead of more multiplayer mechanics making their way online.

Like the earlier leaks, the reason seems to be that beta files for Black Ops 6 were uploaded to the PSN database for PlayStation 4 users, according to the official Charlie Intel X/Twitter account. Based on recent trailers, Black Ops 6 takes place in the '90s at the end of the Cold War and will feature legacy characters such as Woods and Adler. Similar to Black Ops Cold War, the game will have players second-guessing who they can trust.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 - Everything To Know So Far

As previously mentioned, the upcoming Call of Duty has been hit with multiple leaks. Last week, footage of the meat shield mechanic made its way online. In addition to the leaks, news has been steadily rolling out. It was recently announced that Zombies mode would have an Arachnophobia setting that'll make the spider-like enemies a little less terrifying. It's also worth pointing out that Black Ops 6 will also be coming to Game Pass when it releases.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is scheduled to come out later this year on October 25. It'll be playable on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and PC.
